body.raw:
Innovate faster,

simpler and smarter.

Strategy

Customer Journey Mapping.
Rapid Value Proposition by Design.
Business Model Development.
Strategic Planning.

Project Management.
Creative Production.

Consulting

Work
with us

hello@polything.co.uk

See if there is a fit. Book a 15 min call.
Booking Link

Latest Posts

  • Strategic Marketing Consultancy

    In today’s highly competitive business landscape, having a well-crafted marketing strategy is crucial for success. However, navigating the complexities of marketing can be challenging, especially for businesses with limited resources or specialised expertise. This is where strategic marketing consultants come into play, offering invaluable guidance and solutions tailored to your unique needs. In this comprehensive…

    Read more

    May 18, 2024

  • Marketing Consultancy in London – The secret to growing your business

    Choosing the right marketing consultancy in London is crucial for the success of your business and marketing campaigns. Find out more in this article.

    Read more

    May 6, 2023

  • Enhancing Your SEO for Better Online Visibility

    Enhancing your SEO strategies is essential for improving online visibility. This comprehensive guide covers the definition and importance of SEO visibility, key metrics and tools to measure it, and the major factors influencing it such as search engine rankings, mobile-friendliness, page speed, content quality, backlink strategy, and technical SEO factors.

    Read more

    September 23, 2024

  • Marketing Automation and Technology

    Discover how marketing automation and technology can revolutionise your marketing strategy. This article explores the benefits, essential tools, implementation tips, and future trends to streamline your efforts and drive growth. Learn from real-life success stories and gain actionable insights to boost your marketing efficiency. Read on to transform your approach!

    Read more

    August 26, 2024

  • Understanding customer journey maps – A guide to the process

    Read on to understand how focusing on the customer journey can make your business more customer-centric and elevate your marketing.

    Read more

    July 29, 2024

title: Claim your free strategy session – Book a call

seo.title: Claim your free strategy session – Book a call
seo.description: Book a free 30-minute strategy session We obsess about all things marketing strategy and would

body.raw:
Book a free 30-minute strategy session

We obsess about all things marketing strategy and would love to talk about how our Momentum model will help your business achieve a better product-market fit, get more consistent results and a better return on your marketing spend.

During your free phone consultation, we will discuss the following:

  • How to quickly spot gaps in your marketing efforts.
  • How to align your product more closely to consumer needs.
  • How to create a clear value proposition that resonates with consumers.
  • How to easily implement the core frameworks to scale your marketing and business.
  • How to create a strategic marketing model to catapult revenue and increase return on investment.

It is a 100% free no-obligation, no strings attached consultation. Just pick a date and time that works for you and confirm your session.

Beth Mawdsley
08:50 24 Apr 25
Chris changed my ways of working tremendously during our coaching sessions. Every barrier I was facing Chris found solutions that were easy to implement and use moving forward.
We had great discussions every session and Chris always picked up on little details in what I was saying and was able to find the most amazing information to send over which I not only found useful for myself but was also able to share with my colleagues who also found the information very useful. In all honesty I didn't want my sessions with Chris to end! I started our sessions with low confidence and a bit of a mess in my head as to the structure of my working day and I came out with clear plans and strategies thanks to Chris. I highly recommend Chris's coaching sessions. Thank you so much!
Thomas Graham
15:37 01 Aug 24
I was allocated coaching sessions by my access to work assessor, but I did not know what to expect and came to this process open-minded. Chris made me feel comfortable from the first session and I have learned a lot from him over the past 6 months. I feel more confident in my role and appreciate all the work that we have done together. I will take the skills and tools into my daily practice. Thank you for all you have done for me over the past 6 months
Anurah Farrell
15:13 15 Apr 24
Chris was very helpful in helping me understand how I could re-target exiting potential prospects and diagnosing if my FB Ads Manager Account was set up correctly. Thank you!
Ben Cosbie Ross
19:17 09 Apr 24
I was introduced to Chris via work. The coach coachee relationship is the key element to make the sessions work and from the start of the very first session Chris made it very easy. My reservations were around a formulaic lesson by lesson method but Chris worked with me to get the best outcomes. Chris was able to provide insight in multiple areas, often within a very short window, and with zero preparation. The sessions were conversational, which, was exactly what worked for me. Every session was beneficial and it was a shame when our sessions ended. I am very confident in recommending Chris to anyone who is thinking about engaging an ND coach. Chris is thoughtful, genuine and empathetic and is an outstanding coach.
Benoit Collin
11:01 18 Mar 24
I had the pleasure of having multiple mentoring sessions with Chris, and his guidance was pivotal in refining my start-up idea, identifying our target persona, and establishing a clear customer value proposition. Anyone looking to grow their business would greatly benefit from his mentorship/expertise. Highly recommended!
Jay Maniar
15:35 27 Apr 23
I booked a mentoring session with Chris who was brilliant at walking me through the complex world of Facebook advertising. Really patient and generous with his knowledge.
Ellora Coupe
09:17 21 Mar 23
The mentoring I have received as a small business entrepreneur has been invaluable. Chris has helped me to understand new opportunities, how to focus on bringing value to my customers and provided a huge amount of support in getting my business launched and off the ground. It has proven to me the huge value in mentoring that small businesses can benefit from.
jon draper
17:02 25 Jan 23
Spoke with Chris today. He is personable and clearly knows more about the subject than I could ever learn. Despite this he kept it simple and relevant. Really helping me get an understanding of what is necessary to start my SEO journey.
Ellie Good
14:01 28 Nov 22
My SEO session with Chris was incredibly informative, with advice and suggestions tailored for my level of understanding. I now have a clear idea of what needs to be done to improve the areas in question. Thank you!
Don Magrane
14:57 03 Nov 22
Spent some time with Chris discussing our PPC, audience targeting and content strategy. Incredibly useful. We have plenty of targeted action points to work on for the mid to long term which will be very helpful for our business.
Thalia Shaw
10:14 18 Oct 22
Chris is a very experience marketing and digital marketing expert with so much knowledge. I had a very interesting and insightful 60 minute session with him with practical actions to put in place in my business.
Gilly Thompson
15:10 14 Oct 22
Chris, is a font of all marketing and digital marketing knowlegde.

I learnt more about digital marketing in 20 minutes with Chris than i did in 3 years!!

I am now doing reels on insta with view of between £5k - £12k

Incredible, he is supportive and has brilliant ideas for generate brand awareness, loyalty and sales
Daniel Johnson
05:34 11 Oct 22
During our 60-min problem-solving call Chris was able to provide a series of well-informed, practical and realistic suggestions on possible next steps for our business.
Book a call

Can’t wait? Then give us a call now on: +44 208 0640312

Book a call

seo.title: Strategic Marketing Consultants – Our Approach
seo.description: An introduction to our strategic marketing consultancy model As strategic marketing consultants, the Momentum Model

body.raw:
An introduction to our strategic marketing consultancy model

As strategic marketing consultants, the Momentum Model is our primary method of engaging with clients. It is an agile, collaborative and results-focused approach to building and delivering innovative marketing programmes. The model is great for voicing consumer needs, envisioning the future and uncovering fresh insights which may have been overlooked as part of more traditional approaches. It is also useful for reframing business challenges and helping to manage change, especially cultural change. 

The Momentum Model has been based on over 20 years of practical marketing experience, and five years of experience working directly with a diverse range of direct-to-consumer organisations. Through our consultancy, we saw directly how companies struggle with scaling their marketing exponentially, whilst delivering creativity and remaining focused on serving their customers.

The Momentum Model creates the conditions where collaboration and creativity can flourish between multi-disciplinary teams, whilst incrementally improving strategy, outputs and tactical performance.

Benefits of this method

Validation beats guesswork

By collaborating across internal, external and extended teams, new perspectives and ideas can be rapidly generated and validated before deploying in the real world.

Structured approach

To successfully scale or launch a marketing programme, firstly, all stakeholders have to be confident in the insight, methodology and approach. We used ‘tested in the wild’ frameworks, methods, tools and playbooks to design an engagement specifically for your needs. Collaboration ensures that everyone in your team has been on the same journey.

Unexpected benefits

Giving your teams a common language to articulate your business, its issues, and solutions across product, marketing, sales and operations have unexpected upsides. We see time and again, that although this method is broadly a marketing process, teams will discover and solve business-critical issues across product, development, culture and training within your organisation. They will also find new opportunities in these areas too.

Training and iterative learning

Through the engagement, the team will learn a common language, ways of describing both business and consumer needs, as well as its problems and challenges. They will become well versed in a variety of strategic frameworks that can be used in the future and that will eventually become part of your company culture. When stakeholders continue to share their journey with their teams, the method will become ingrained in your business, realising benefits and new ideas for years to come.

Business agility

Marketing and business practice has moved on from traditional ‘waterfall’ planning and delivery cycles. This model gives your business the ability to refine strategy, innovate, and manage tactical delivery simultaneously. The framework will give you the ability to adapt to market changes, new consumer trends as well as wider macro forces.

A collaborative model for scaling marketing results

Inject your business with fresh perspectives, insight and new ideas on how to best serve your customers in the future. Elevated marketing results rarely occur in the context of the same stakeholders sitting in a meeting room day in and day out. Delivering and scaling award-winning marketing programmes now requires collaboration skills and the co-creation of a killer strategy that will resonate with consumers in an attention-deficit world.

Exploration
Collaboration
Experimentation
Implementation

While our approach, methods and tools work for any size of direct to consumer business, in any industry, we treat each engagement as unique.

Depending on the situation, we can bring in experts, influencers, consumers or users to the process to bring fresh perspectives and ideas to your product or problem. Or, we can simply guide your team through a set of frameworks and give you the right tools to do the job at hand.

In each engagement, we prepare a bespoke programme based on our initial discovery session. We then facilitate a process to suit your exact needs. Each element will be designed to deliver actionable insight from day one, and a robust strategy at the end of the engagement. In addition, participants will enjoy a hands-on learning experience, and be able to use the outcomes of each session to incrementally improve products, marketing and business processes.

Contact Us

Is your brand truly distinctive?

Many brands struggle to carve out a unique space in their market. Your brand’s unique value proposition should be a shining beacon, not a distant glimmer.

Our diagnostic tool measures how well your brand establishes a unique emotional connection maintains consistency across all touchpoints, and adapts to market changes—all the while staying true to its core identity.

Dare to find out the truth with our Distinctive Brand Index assessment. The results might surprise you!

Take the Assessment

Our Founder

Chris has over twenty years of experience in marketing across, media, startups and scale-up businesses. He has led multi-disciplinary teams in marketing, development and monetisation as well as bringing together teams across Europe to work effectively on consumer-based marketing strategy.

He has also led brand marketing activations for clients such as Ford, Three, EE, Jeep, HTC, Casio, British Airways, Lastminute, Nintendo & BMW.

Giving back is a big priority for Chris; he mentors on the Digital Boost platform as well as the Help to Grow programme and is currently studying with the ILM for a Certificate and Diploma in Effective Coaching and Mentoring.

He is also a Leadership qualified Trustee, a member of ILM, ABM, and an Advisor and strategist for UK Business Advisors.

seo.title: Business Mentoring and Coaching
seo.description: Selected Clients Empower your business with accredited business mentoring and coaching Personalised support for both

body.raw:
Struggling to make progress with your business?

Meet polything mentoring and coaching

Discover the path to a happier and healthier business.

Book a call to see if we are a fit

Speak with an accredited coach and mentor today.

  • Free discovery call – Zero commitment
  • Professional engagements for you, or your team
  • Payment options available

Accreditations & Memberships

Selected
Clients

Empower your business with accredited business mentoring and coaching

Book a call

Personalised support for both neurodiverse and neuro-typical founders and business owners to achieve their full potential.

Discover how Polything’s business mentoring and coaching services provide personalised support tailored to your unique challenges. Our engagements are designed to help neurodiverse founders and business owners overcome challenges and achieve success with confidence, but equally help neuro-typical people too.

Customer Reviews

” Mentoring really helped me break down some issues and pinpoint the causes.

Gave me lots of ideas to consider and a different perspective of the products we offer. This was my first time using a mentor and he made me feel welcome and was very friendly. “

– Kristina Stazaker, Managing Director at Out of the Ashes Ltd
Beth Mawdsley
08:50 24 Apr 25
Chris changed my ways of working tremendously during our coaching sessions. Every barrier I was facing Chris found solutions that were easy to implement and use moving forward.
We had great discussions every session and Chris always picked up on little details in what I was saying and was able to find the most amazing information to send over which I not only found useful for myself but was also able to share with my colleagues who also found the information very useful. In all honesty I didn't want my sessions with Chris to end! I started our sessions with low confidence and a bit of a mess in my head as to the structure of my working day and I came out with clear plans and strategies thanks to Chris. I highly recommend Chris's coaching sessions. Thank you so much!
Thomas Graham
15:37 01 Aug 24
I was allocated coaching sessions by my access to work assessor, but I did not know what to expect and came to this process open-minded. Chris made me feel comfortable from the first session and I have learned a lot from him over the past 6 months. I feel more confident in my role and appreciate all the work that we have done together. I will take the skills and tools into my daily practice. Thank you for all you have done for me over the past 6 months
Anurah Farrell
15:13 15 Apr 24
Chris was very helpful in helping me understand how I could re-target exiting potential prospects and diagnosing if my FB Ads Manager Account was set up correctly. Thank you!
Ben Cosbie Ross
19:17 09 Apr 24
I was introduced to Chris via work. The coach coachee relationship is the key element to make the sessions work and from the start of the very first session Chris made it very easy. My reservations were around a formulaic lesson by lesson method but Chris worked with me to get the best outcomes. Chris was able to provide insight in multiple areas, often within a very short window, and with zero preparation. The sessions were conversational, which, was exactly what worked for me. Every session was beneficial and it was a shame when our sessions ended. I am very confident in recommending Chris to anyone who is thinking about engaging an ND coach. Chris is thoughtful, genuine and empathetic and is an outstanding coach.
Benoit Collin
11:01 18 Mar 24
I had the pleasure of having multiple mentoring sessions with Chris, and his guidance was pivotal in refining my start-up idea, identifying our target persona, and establishing a clear customer value proposition. Anyone looking to grow their business would greatly benefit from his mentorship/expertise. Highly recommended!
Jay Maniar
15:35 27 Apr 23
I booked a mentoring session with Chris who was brilliant at walking me through the complex world of Facebook advertising. Really patient and generous with his knowledge.
Ellora Coupe
09:17 21 Mar 23
The mentoring I have received as a small business entrepreneur has been invaluable. Chris has helped me to understand new opportunities, how to focus on bringing value to my customers and provided a huge amount of support in getting my business launched and off the ground. It has proven to me the huge value in mentoring that small businesses can benefit from.
jon draper
17:02 25 Jan 23
Spoke with Chris today. He is personable and clearly knows more about the subject than I could ever learn. Despite this he kept it simple and relevant. Really helping me get an understanding of what is necessary to start my SEO journey.
Ellie Good
14:01 28 Nov 22
My SEO session with Chris was incredibly informative, with advice and suggestions tailored for my level of understanding. I now have a clear idea of what needs to be done to improve the areas in question. Thank you!
Don Magrane
14:57 03 Nov 22
Spent some time with Chris discussing our PPC, audience targeting and content strategy. Incredibly useful. We have plenty of targeted action points to work on for the mid to long term which will be very helpful for our business.
Thalia Shaw
10:14 18 Oct 22
Chris is a very experience marketing and digital marketing expert with so much knowledge. I had a very interesting and insightful 60 minute session with him with practical actions to put in place in my business.
Gilly Thompson
15:10 14 Oct 22
Chris, is a font of all marketing and digital marketing knowlegde.

I learnt more about digital marketing in 20 minutes with Chris than i did in 3 years!!

I am now doing reels on insta with view of between £5k - £12k

Incredible, he is supportive and has brilliant ideas for generate brand awareness, loyalty and sales
Daniel Johnson
05:34 11 Oct 22
During our 60-min problem-solving call Chris was able to provide a series of well-informed, practical and realistic suggestions on possible next steps for our business.
Business Mentoring Benefits

Fast-track your business progress

Direct access to a qualified mentor with a track record of growing businesses.

Unique growth plans tailored to your specific business goals and challenges.

Soundboard your ideas with a trusted mentor

Hands-on support with regular check-ins and on-demand guidance.

Access to an extensive library of marketing resources, tools, and templates

Get clear on your path to success

Custom growth plans and strategies uniquely tailored to your business.

Hands-On Guidance – real-time support for immediate challenges.

Networking opportunities and shared learning experiences.

Our business mentoring packages

Getting Started

Typical Duration: 3 Months
Sessions: 5 sessions, 60 minutes.

This package is designed to kick-start your journey towards change. We’ll cover goal setting, identifying obstacles, creating a plan of action, and building resilience to manage setbacks

  • Session handouts
  • Email support between sessions
  • Access to our online resource hub


Who it’s for: Anyone who wants to commit to changing their business or work life, but has been unable to do it independently.

£1,450 +VAT

Progress Plan

Duration: 5-7 Months
Sessions: 8 sessions, 90 minutes.

This is our most popular package and is all about maintaining momentum and making consistent progress. We’ll focus on refining your strategy, enhancing your skills, overcoming challenges, and celebrating achievements.

  • Session handouts
  • Email support between sessions
  • Ad hoc Slack/Whatsapp check-ins
  • Access to our online resource hub


Who it’s for: Ideal for those entrepreneurs who have started their journey towards change and are looking for sustained support and regular check-ins to keep them on track.

£1,900 +VAT

Signature Plan

Duration: 7-9 Months
Sessions: 11 sessions, 90 minutes.

This comprehensive package is designed to facilitate deep, lasting change. We’ll delve into advanced strategies for overcoming obstacles, enhancing performance, and maintaining progress. We’ll also focus on personal development, leadership skills, and work-life balance.

  • Session handouts
  • Email support between sessions
  • A personalised action plan
  • Ad hoc Slack/Whatsapp check-ins
  • Access to our online resource hub

Who it’s for: This package is for business owners committed to significantly changing their career or business and ready to invest time and effort into their personal and professional growth. If you recognise that the change you want to make requires significant commitment, this package is for you.

£2,499 +VAT

GET IN TOUCH

Book a call

Video Case Studies

Try our momentum assessment to gain clarity on your strengths

Are you ready to find clarity on your greatest business strengths?

Alignment

Is your business model working with your brain or fighting it?

Clarity

Do you know what to focus on next, or are you spinning too many plates?

Momentum

How consistently are you moving forward without burning out?

Get your free assessment now
Business mentoring process

How it works

Step 1 – Contact Us

Schedule a free consultation to discuss your needs. We will explain more about the process and start to tailor a plan just for you.

Step 2 – Choose your preferred plan

Book your preferred plan around your commitments. Join a discovery call where we will discuss your goals and challenges in detail and start to plan.

Step 3 – Achieve Results

Join the sessions, undertake your actions and watch your business grow with our tailored support.

What is included

  • Flexibility –  Sessions and support tailored to your schedule. We work around your business, not the other way around.
  • Customised Growth Plan – A strategy uniquely tailored to your business goals and challenges.
  • Resource Library Access –  An extensive collection of marketing resources, tools, and templates.
  • Personalised Mentoring Sessions – Direct access to an expert marketer and qualified mentor with a track record of scaling businesses.
  • Hands-On Support – Regular check-ins and on-demand support for real-time guidance.
  • Community Access – Membership in an exclusive community of entrepreneurs and startups.

Additional Benefits

  • Guaranteed Results – If you don’t see tangible progress and growth in your business during the sessions, we will offer additional support sessions at no extra cost.
  • Zero Risk – The first session is free with no obligation to continue. Experience the value firsthand before making a decision.
  • Flexibility –  Sessions and support tailored to your schedule. We work around your business, not the other way around.

GET IN TOUCH

Take control of your business

Book a call

Association Memberships

Business Mentoring FAQs

What is business mentoring?

Business mentoring involves experienced professionals providing guidance and support to help business owners develop their skills, make informed decisions, and achieve their business goals. Find out more about what business mentoring is and more helpfully, it isn’t.

What skills should a good mentor have?

A good mentor should possess strong communication skills, active listening, empathy, patience, problem-solving abilities, and a deep understanding of the business landscape. Additionally, they should be able to provide constructive feedback, inspire and motivate, and maintain confidentiality.

How do I find a good business mentor?

Look for mentors with relevant experience, a strong track record, and a mentoring style that aligns with your needs. Networking events, professional associations (such as the ABM), and online platforms can help you connect with potential mentors. We have created this handy article to help you choose the right mentor for you.

How much do business mentors charge in the UK?

Business mentor rates in the UK can vary widely, typically ranging from £50 to £300+ per hour, depending on the mentor’s experience and expertise.

What is the difference between a business advisor and a business mentor?

A business advisor provides specific advice on business operations and strategy, while a business mentor offers broader guidance, support, and personal development.

Are business mentors worth it?

We are biased, but having experienced being a mentor and mentee, yes, business mentors can provide valuable insights, support, and connections that can significantly impact a business’s growth and success. Find out more about the benefits of business mentoring.

What is the difference between a business coach and a business mentor?

A business coach focuses on specific skills and performance, often with a structured approach, while a business mentor provides broader, more holistic guidance and support

What are the 3 types of mentoring?

Traditional Mentoring: One-on-one guidance from a mentor.
Group Mentoring: A mentor works with several mentees simultaneously.
Peer Mentoring: Colleagues or peers at similar levels mentor each other.

What can a business mentor do for you?

A business mentor can provide insights, feedback, connections, and support, helping you to make informed decisions and accelerate your business growth.

What are the 5 pillars of mentorship?

Trust: Building a reliable relationship.
Respect: Mutual regard for each other’s experience and insights.
Support: Providing emotional and professional support.
Guidance: Offering direction and advice.
Accountability: Ensuring goals are set and achieved

What should a mentor not do?

A mentor should not impose their solutions, breach confidentiality, or neglect the mentoring relationship.

What is a small business mentor?

A small business mentor provides personalised guidance, support, and advice to help small business owners overcome challenges and achieve their goals.

  • How to choose the right coach or mentor

    Looking for a coach or mentor? Discover how to choose the right coach or mentor based on their knowledge, skills, and behaviours. Find out now.

    Read more

    April 5, 2023

  • Personal business coaching: A guide to improving your professional life

    Looking to improve your professional life and achieve your business goals? Personal business coaching can provide you with the support, guidance, and accountability you need to succeed.

    Read more

    March 24, 2023

  • Best practices and strategies for successful mentoring

    Learn how your business can identify and overcome potential barriers to effective mentoring. Discover strategies for successful mentoring.

    Read more

    March 22, 2023

seo.title: Cookie Policy
seo.description: About this cookie policy This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are and how we use

body.raw:
# About this cookie policy

This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are and how we use them, the types of cookies we use, the information we collect using cookies and how that information is used, and how to control the cookie preferences. For further information on how we use, store, and keep your personal data secure, see our Privacy Policy.

You can at any time change or withdraw your consent from the Cookie Declaration on our website.

Learn more about who we are, how you can contact us, and how we process personal data in our Privacy Policy.

Your consent applies to the following domains: polything.co.uk

## What are cookies?

Cookies are small text files that are used to store small pieces of information. They are stored on your device when the website is loaded on your browser. These cookies help us make the website function properly, make it more secure, provide better user experience, and understand how the website performs and to analyze what works and where it needs improvement.

### How do we use cookies?

As most of the online services, our website uses first-party and third-party cookies for several purposes. First-party cookies are mostly necessary for the website to function the right way, and they do not collect any of your personally identifiable data.

The third-party cookies used on our website are mainly for understanding how the website performs, how you interact with our website, keeping our services secure, providing advertisements that are relevant to you, and all in all providing you with a better and improved user experience and help speed up your future interactions with our website.

### What types of cookies do we use?

**Essential:** Some cookies are essential for you to be able to experience the full functionality of our site. They allow us to maintain user sessions and prevent any security threats. They do not collect or store any personal information. For example, these cookies allow you to log-in to your account and add products to your basket, and checkout securely.

**Statistics:** These cookies store information like the number of visitors to the website, the number of unique visitors, which pages of the website have been visited, the source of the visit, etc. These data help us understand and analyze how well the website performs and where it needs improvement.

**Marketing:** Our website displays advertisements. These cookies are used to personalize the advertisements that we show to you so that they are meaningful to you. These cookies also help us keep track of the efficiency of these ad campaigns. The information stored in these cookies may also be used by the third-party ad providers to show you ads on other websites on the browser as well.

**Functional:** These are the cookies that help certain non-essential functionalities on our website. These functionalities include embedding content like videos or sharing content of the website on social media platforms.

**Preferences:** These cookies help us store your settings and browsing preferences like language preferences so that you have a better and efficient experience on future visits to the website.

### How can I control the cookie preferences?

Should you decide to change your preferences later through your browsing session, you can click on the "Manage consent" tab on your screen. This will display the consent notice again enabling you to change your preferences or withdraw your consent entirely.

In addition to this, different browsers provide different methods to block and delete cookies used by websites. You can change the settings of your browser to block/delete the cookies. To find out more about how to manage and delete cookies, visit [wikipedia.org](https://wikipedia.org) or [www.allaboutcookies.org](https://www.allaboutcookies.org).

seo.title: Craft Marketing Services for Growth
seo.description: Craft Marketing Services Designed for growing businesses Perfect for both established businesses and smaller

body.raw:
Finding it hard to scale your marketing outPut?

Transform Your Business with Craft Marketing Services

A single subscription service for all your creative and marketing needs.

Book a call to see if we are a fit

Let’s build you a predictable marketing machine.

  • Free discovery call – Zero commitment
  • We work with and around your existing team
  • Flexible subscription tiers tailored to your needs

Review and Ratings

Polything
5.0
Based on 18 reviews
powered by Google

Craft Marketing Services – Designed for growing businesses

Perfect for both established businesses and smaller companies looking to kick-start their marketing activities.

Craft offers scalable solutions to meet your evolving needs. In order to maintain a high standard of service for our clients, we limit the number of Craft subscriptions available, ensuring personalised attention and bespoke solutions for each client we work with.

If you don’t see a measurable improvement in your marketing performance within the first three months, we offer a complimentary strategy reassessment to realign your goals and strategy. 

Sign up for Craft today and receive a bonus marketing strategy session, where we’ll outline key steps to galvanise your marketing journey.

Book a call

What our customers say

“I would highly recommend them!!”

“They transformed the way we look at our online presence from the design of our site to our social media and content presence. Chris is an absolute pleasure to work with, extremely knowledgeable and has worked seamlessly with our team to make the necessary changes within our online offering.”

– Jon Case
CEO at SSS Learning Ltd

“Their wealth of experience was the deciding factor.”

“WOLF brought in more than 2 million new users from our target market in its first two years since brand launch. Polything assisted with a serious chunk of that due to the campaigns they worked on, and the creative and operational work they did to assist our MENA regionally-led influencer marketing campaigns that brought in the rest. I was very grateful to Polything.”

– Adam Gold
CCO at WOLF Live

“A huge impact on our business…”

“His work on our branded content proposition, productisation and social has transformed the way we look at monetising content. He has become a highly regarded part of the team and his knowledge, creativity, innovation and ingenuity have been invaluable in helping to develop our business.”

– Chris Dicker
CEO at Candr Media Group

Marketing Services Subscription Benefits

Comprehensive Services

An all-in-one solution for your creative and marketing needs. We start with your needs to develop bespoke solutions, rather than offering pre-packaged services.

Starting from scratch? No problem, we’ll help define what you need to build out a full programme of marketing activity. 

Work with a team of experienced marketing professionals and creatives dedicated to your brand’s success.

Tailored Solutions

Our solutions are customisable to fit your specific marketing goals. Think of us as an extension of your team, working with you to define and deliver your personalised marketing plan.

Craft is priced to offer maximum value, providing top-tier marketing services at a predictable, fixed cost. It’s an investment in your brand’s growth, designed to be accessible for businesses of all sizes, with no hidden costs.

Scalable Support

As your business grows, Craft grows with you, offering scalable solutions and add-ons that adapt to your changing needs. We understand that things change and evolve over time, and so as they do, we bring new specialists into your team as your knowledge and results grow.

Access expertise at your fingertips, with our team of creatives and marketing experts, bringing years of experience and innovative strategies to your brand.

Book a call

Case Studies

BLACKRIVER RAMPS

Black Friday / Cyber Monday Campaign – 22% increase in revenue compared to the previous year, and a 14.55 ROAS.

Explore

WOLF

The Worlds Online Festival – 2 million new users from our target market in its first two years since brand launch.

Explore

BLUEFORT

Explore how we refined Bluefort Security’s marketing with CRAFT and drove success.

Explore
Types of Creative and Marketing Services

Creative Production Services

  • Design – Professional graphic design services tailored to your brand.
  • Video – High-quality video production to engage your audience.
  • Animation – Creative animations to bring your ideas to life.
  • Copywriting – Compelling copy that resonates with your target audience.
  • Photography – Stunning visuals to enhance your brand’s presence.
  • Project Management – Seamless project execution from start to finish.

Marketing Services

  • PPC (Pay-Per-Click) – Effective ad campaigns to drive traffic and sales.
  • SEO (Search Engine Optimisation) – Boost your online visibility and rankings.
  • Campaign Planning – Tactical planning for impactful marketing campaigns.
  • Paid Media -Targeted advertising to reach your ideal customers.
  • Brief Creation – Crafting detailed briefs to ensure successful project outcomes.
  • Tendering – Managing the tendering process for collaborations with other third parties.
Our Subscription Tiers

Essentials

Typical Hours of Work: 50 hours per month
Givens: A dedicated Project Manager

This package is designed to kickstart your marketing journey. We provide foundational marketing services to establish and strengthen your brand presence. Perfect for businesses needing an initial setup and quick wins.

This plan includes the standard creative service list which includes; design, video production, copywriting, and more to set your marketing efforts in motion.

  • A dedicated project manager
  • An on-demand creative team
  • Turnaround times from 10 hours
  • Unlimited stakeholders and asset storage
  • Standard creative service list


Who it’s for: Startups and smaller established businesses needing initial setup and quick wins with basic marketing needs.

£5,000 per month

Growth

Typical Hours of Work: 80 hours per month
Givens: A dedicated Project Manager

This is our most popular package and is all about maintaining momentum and making consistent progress. Ideal for businesses seeking sustained support.

It includes all services from the Essentials, plus extra marketing consultancy to troubleshoot any issues you have with campaigns as well as access to our specialist marketing team to manage campaigns.

  • A dedicated project manager
  • An on-demand creative team
  • An on-demand marketing team
  • Turnaround times from 10 hours
  • Unlimited stakeholders and asset storage
  • Standard service list
  • Marketing consulting
  • Priority support


Who it’s for: Established businesses ready to scale who are in need of sustained support, advanced strategies, and regular engagement.

£7,500 per month

Fully Comp

Typical Hours of Work: 120 hours per month
Givens: A dedicated Project Manager

This comprehensive package is designed for clients who need extensive support and advanced marketing solutions. They may also need a higher level of production values in their video output.

This plan includes all services from the Growth, plus access to strategy consultancy, and our extended service list which includes; premium video production, adnaced animation, motion design, AR/3D design and additional project management.

  • A dedicated project manager
  • An on-demand creative team
  • An on-demand marketing team
  • Turnaround times from 10 hours
  • Unlimited stakeholders and asset storage
  • Extended service list
  • Marketing consulting
  • Strategy consulting

Who it’s for: Ambitious scaling businesses committed to comprehensive, long-term marketing solutions and significant growth.

£10,000 per month

GET IN TOUCH

Book a call

Selected
Clients

Marketing Services Subscription

How it works

Step 1 – Subscribe

Choose a subscription plan that fits your needs.

Our subscription model offers flexibility and scalability to support your growth.

Step 2 – Implement

Our team executes your marketing plan meticulously.

We’ll kick off with a comprehensive onboarding session to understand your business goals.

Our team of experts will then start working on your marketing activities, handling everything from creative production to digital marketing campaigns with precision and care.

Step 3 – Grow

Watch your business thrive with consistent and high-quality marketing support. Get regular updates and reports on your marketing campaigns and creative output.

Enjoy continuous support and guidance from our experienced professionals to ensure your marketing efforts remain effective and aligned with your business goals.

Craft Marketing Services

What is included

  • Expertise at Your Fingertips – Access to a team of creatives and marketing experts, bringing years of experience and innovative strategies to your brand.
  • Design Services – Enhance your brand with professional graphic design.
  • Photography – Boost your brand’s presence with stunning visuals.
  • Video Production – Engage your audience with high-quality video content
  • Copywriting – Craft compelling content that resonates with your target audience.
  • Brief Creation – Detailed briefs to ensure successful projects.
  • A Dedicated Project Manager – Direct access to an expert project manager who will be your champion. Seamless project execution from start to finish is included in every tier of service.
  • Campaign Planning – Detailed planning for impactful marketing campaigns.
  • Paid Media – Targeted advertising to reach your ideal customers.
  • Content Marketing – Tailored content strategies to engage and convert your audience.
  • PPC & SEO – Reviews and analysis, managed services as a bolt-on.

Additional Benefits

  • Easy to Get Started – Speak to us to see if we are a good fit. Then you can co-design a package with us that meets your needs.
  • Satisfaction Guarantee – If you don’t see a measurable improvement in your marketing outcomes within the first three months, we offer a complimentary strategy reassessment to realign with your goals.
  • Predictable Investment – Fixed pricing takes the guesswork out of budgeting for marketing making it easier to plan and invest in your growth.
  • Affordability – Craft is priced to offer maximum value, providing top-tier marketing services at a predictable, fixed cost. It’s an investment in your brand’s growth, designed to be accessible for businesses of all sizes.
  • Flexibility –  Sessions and support tailored to your schedule. We work around your business, not the other way around.
  • Exclusive Access – We have no ambitions of becoming an agency. Our limited availability ensures that each Craft client receives the focused, dedicated support they deserve.
Get in Touch
Book a call

It’s important that we are a good fit, as we have to limit the number of Craft subscriptions we can deliver.

Association Memberships

Marketing Services FAQs

How much should I pay for marketing services?

The cost varies depending on the type of services that you need. As a rough guide you could expect to spend between the following according to Clutch’s Insights (data last updated May 2024):
– PPC Services £1,000-£10,000+ per month depending on your media budget
– SEO Services an average of less than £7,800 per month for most businesses
– Social Media Services including paid an average of less than £7,800 per month for most businesses
– Design Services between £10,000 and £40,000 per project
– Marketing Strategy Services – £10,000 and £40,000 per project

How much does a marketing plan cost in the UK?

A comprehensive marketing plan in the UK typically costs between £2,000 and £9,000, depending on the complexity and scope of the project.

Is it worth paying a marketing services company?

We are biased, but yes, paying a marketing company can be worth it for the expertise, time savings, and potential ROI they can provide, especially if you lack in-house marketing capabilities.

Why is marketing so expensive?

Marketing can be expensive due to the need for skilled professionals, extensive research, multiple channels, and the continuous effort required to maintain and optimise campaigns.

What is a reasonable marketing budget for a small business?

A reasonable marketing budget for a small business typically ranges from 5% to 10% of total revenue, depending on growth goals and industry standards.

What is the average marketing budget in the UK?

The average marketing budget in the UK varies by industry but generally falls between 5% and 15% of a company’s total revenue. According to YouGov the average was 9.33% of annual revenue in 2019.

What is a reasonable amount to spend on marketing?

A reasonable amount to spend on marketing is around 7-8% of your total revenue, though this can vary based on your sector and specific business needs and goals.

What is a typical marketing budget for a startup?

Startups typically allocate between 12% and 20% of their revenue to marketing to build brand awareness and drive initial growth. According to HubSpot the average was 11.2% of revenue at the end of 2022

Is there a satisfaction guarantee?

Yes, if you don’t see tangible growth within a set period, we offer additional support sessions at no extra cost.

How can I contact Polything?

Via email at contact@polything.co.uk or phone at +44 208 0640312.

body.raw:
Is your brand truly distinctive? Or just another face in the crowd?

Many brands struggle to carve out a unique space in their market. Your brand’s unique value proposition should be a shining beacon, not a distant glimmer.

Our diagnostic tool measures how well your brand establishes a unique emotional connection maintains consistency across all touchpoints, and adapts to market changes—all the while staying true to its core identity.

Dare to find out the truth with our Distinctive Brand Index assessment. The results might surprise you!

Take the Assessment

seo.title: Privacy Policy
seo.description: Polything Privacy Policy Introduction This privacy notice provides you with details of how we collect

body.raw:
Polything Privacy Policy

Introduction

This privacy notice provides you with details of how we collect and process your personal data through your use of our site https://polything.co.uk.

By providing us with your data, you warrant to us that you are over 13 years of age.

Polything Ltd is the data controller and we are responsible for your personal data (referred to as “we”, “us” or “our” in this privacy notice).

Contact Details

Our legal entity details are:

The full name and legal entity is: Polything Ltd

Registered address: We are registered in England and Wales under registration number 11535063, and our registered office is Tower House, 269 Walmersley Road, Bury,  Lancashire, BL9 6NX although our trading address is in London.

Email address: contact@polything.co.uk

It is very important that the information we hold about you is accurate and up to date. Please let us know if at any time your personal information changes by emailing us at contact@polything.co.uk

What data do we collect, for what purposes, and why do we process it?

Personal data means any information capable of identifying an individual. It does not include anonymised data.

We may process the following categories of personal data about you:

Communication Data includes any communication that you send to us whether that be through the contact form on our website, through email, text, social media messaging, social media posting or any other communication that you send us. We process this data for the purposes of communicating with you, for record-keeping and for the establishment, pursuance or defence of legal claims. Our lawful ground for this processing is our legitimate interests which in this case are to reply to communications sent to us, to keep records and to establish, pursue or defend legal claims.

Customer Data includes data relating to any purchases of goods and/or services such as your name, title, billing address, delivery address email address, phone number, contact details, purchase details and card details. We process this data to supply the goods and/or services you have purchased and to keep records of such transactions. Our lawful ground for this processing is the performance of a contract between you and us and/or taking steps at your request to enter into such a contract.

User Data includes data about how you use our website and any online services together with any data that you post for publication on our website or through other online services. We process this data to operate our website and ensure relevant content is provided to you, to ensure the security of our website, to maintain back-ups of our website and/or databases and to enable publication and administration of our website, and other online services and business. Our lawful ground for this processing is our legitimate interests which in this case are to enable us to properly administer our website and our business.

Technical Data that includes data about your use of our website and online services such as your IP address, your login data, details about your browser, length of visit to pages on our website, page views and navigation paths, details about the number of times you use our website, time zone settings and other technology on the devices you use to access our website. The source of this data is our analytics tracking system. We process this data to analyse your use of our website and other online services, to administer and protect our business and website, deliver relevant website content and advertisements to you and to understand the effectiveness of our advertising. Our lawful ground for this processing is our legitimate interests which in this case are to enable us to properly administer our website and our business and grow our business and decide our marketing strategy.

Marketing Data includes data about your preferences in receiving marketing from us and our third parties and your communication preferences. We process this data to enable you to partake in our promotions such as competitions, prize draws and free give-aways, to deliver relevant website content and advertisements to you and measure or understand the effectiveness of this advertising. Our lawful ground for this processing is our legitimate interests which in this case are to study how customers use our products/services, to develop them, grow our business and decide our marketing strategy.

We may use Customer Data, User Data, Technical Data and Marketing Data to deliver relevant website content and advertisements to you (including Facebook adverts or other display advertisements) and to measure or understand the effectiveness of the advertising we serve you. Our lawful ground for this processing is legitimate interests which are to grow our business. We may also use such data to send other marketing communications to you. Our lawful ground for this processing is either consent or legitimate interests (namely to grow our business).

Sensitive Data

We do not collect any Sensitive Data about you. Sensitive data refers to data that includes details about your race or ethnicity, religious or philosophical beliefs, sex life, sexual orientation, political opinions, trade union membership, information about your health and genetic and biometric data. We do not collect any information about criminal convictions and offences. 

Where we are required to collect personal data by law, or under the terms of the contract between us and you do not provide us with that data when requested, we may not be able to perform the contract (for example, to deliver goods or services to you). If you don’t provide us with the requested data, we may have to cancel a product or service you have ordered but if we do, we will notify you at the time.

We will only use your personal data for a purpose it was collected for or a reasonably compatible purpose if necessary. For more information on this please email us at contact@polything.co.uk. In case we need to use your details for an unrelated new purpose we will let you know and explain the legal grounds for processing.

We may process your personal data without your knowledge or consent where this is required or permitted by law.

How we collect data 

We may collect your data by you providing the data directly to us (for example by filling in forms on our site or by sending us emails). We may automatically collect certain data from you through cookies and similar technologies as you use our website. Please see our cookie policy below for more details about this.

We may receive data from third parties such as analytics providers such as Google based outside the EU, advertising networks such as Facebook based outside the EU, such as search information providers such as Google based outside the EU, and providers of technical, payment and delivery services, such as data brokers or aggregators.

We may also receive data from publicly available sources such as Companies House and the Electoral Register based inside the EU.

Marketing Communications

Our lawful ground of processing your personal data to send you marketing communications is either your consent or our legitimate interests (namely to grow our business).

Under the Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations, we may send you marketing communications from us if (i) you made a purchase or asked for information from us about our goods or services or (ii) you agreed to receive marketing communications and in each case you have not opted out of receiving such communications since. Under these regulations, if you are a limited company, we may send you marketing emails without your consent. However, you can still opt-out of receiving marketing emails from us anytime.

Before we share your personal data with any third party for their own marketing purposes we will get your express consent.

You can ask us or third parties to stop sending you marketing messages at any time by following the opt-out links on any marketing message sent to you or OR by emailing us at contact@polything.co.uk at any time.

If you opt-out of receiving marketing communications this opt-out does not apply to personal data provided as a result of other transactions, such as purchases, warranty registrations etc. 

Disclosures of your personal information

We may have to share your personal data with the parties set out below:

  • Service providers who provide IT and system administration services.
  • Professional advisers including lawyers, bankers, auditors and insurers
  • Government bodies that require us to report processing activities.
  • Third parties to whom we sell, transfer, or merge parts of our business or our assets.
  • We require all third parties to whom we transfer your data to respect the security of your personal data and to treat it in accordance with the law. We only allow such third parties to process your personal data for specified purposes and in accordance with our instructions. 

Data Security

We have put in place security measures to prevent your personal data from being accidentally lost, used, altered, disclosed, or accessed without authorisation. We also allow access to your personal data only to those employees and partners who have a business need to know such data. They will only process your personal data on our instructions and they must keep it confidential.

We have procedures in place to deal with any suspected personal data breach and will notify you and any applicable regulator of a breach if we are legally required to.

Data retention

We will only retain your personal data for as long as necessary to fulfil the purposes we collected it for, including the purposes of satisfying any legal, accounting, or reporting requirements.

When deciding what the correct time is to keep the data we look at its amount, nature and sensitivity, potential risk of harm from unauthorised use or disclosure, the processing purposes if these can be achieved by other means and legal requirements.

For tax purposes, the law requires us to keep basic information about our customers (including Contact, Identity, Financial and Transaction Data) for six years after they stop being customers.

In some circumstances, we may anonymise your personal data for research or statistical purposes in which case we may use this information indefinitely without further notice to you.

Your rights

Under data protection laws you have rights in relation to your personal data that include the right to request access, correction, erasure, restriction, transfer, to object to processing, to portability of data and (where the lawful ground of processing is consent) to withdraw consent.

You can see more about these rights at: https://ico.org.uk/

If you wish to exercise any of the rights set out above, please email us at contact@polything.co.uk.

You will not have to pay a fee to access your personal data (or to exercise any of the other rights). However, we may charge a reasonable fee if your request is clearly unfounded, repetitive or excessive or refuse to comply with your request in these circumstances.

We may need to request specific information from you to help us confirm your identity and ensure your right to access your personal data (or to exercise any of your other rights). This is a security measure to ensure that personal data is not disclosed to any person who has no right to receive it. We may also contact you to ask you for further information in relation to your request to speed up our response.

We try to respond to all legitimate requests within one month. Occasionally it may take us longer than a month if your request is particularly complex or you have made a number of requests. In this case, we will notify you.

If you are not happy with any aspect of how we collect and use your data, you have the right to complain to the Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO), the UK supervisory authority for data protection issues (www.ico.org.uk). We would be grateful if you would contact us first if you do have a complaint so that we can try to resolve it for you.

Third-Party Links

This website may include links to third-party websites, plug-ins and applications. Clicking on those links or enabling those connections may allow third parties to collect or share data about you. We do not control these third-party websites and are not responsible for their privacy statements. When you leave our website, we encourage you to read the privacy notice of every website you visit.

Cookies

You can set your browser to refuse all or some browser cookies or to alert you when websites set or access cookies. If you disable or refuse cookies, please note that some parts of this website may become inaccessible or not function properly. 

What is a cookie?

A “cookie” is a piece of information that is stored on your computer’s hard drive and which records how you move your way around a website so that, when you revisit that website, it can present tailored options based on the information stored about your last visit. Cookies can also be used to analyse traffic and for advertising and marketing purposes. 

Cookies are used by nearly all websites and do not harm your system.

If you want to check or change what types of cookies you accept, this can usually be altered within your browser settings. You can block cookies at any time by activating the setting on your browser that allows you to refuse the setting of all or some cookies. However, if you use your browser settings to block all cookies (including essential cookies) you may not be able to access all or parts of our site.

How we use cookies

We use cookies to track your use of our website. This enables us to understand how you use the site and track any patterns of usage on our website. This helps us to develop and improve our website as well as products and/or services in response to what you might need or want.

Cookies are either:

  • Session cookies: these are only stored on your computer during your web session and are automatically deleted when you close your browser – they usually store an anonymous session ID allowing you to browse a website without having to log in to each page but they do not collect any personal data from your computer; or 
  • Persistent cookies: a persistent cookie is stored as a file on your computer and it remains there when you close your web browser. The cookie can be read by the website that created it when you visit that website again. We use persistent cookies for Google Analytics.

Cookies can also be categorised as follows:

  • Strictly necessary cookies: These cookies are essential to enable you to use the website effectively, such as when buying a product and/or service, and therefore cannot be turned off. Without these cookies, the services available to you on our website cannot be provided. These cookies do not gather information about you that could be used for marketing or remembering where you have been on the internet.
  • Performance cookies: These cookies enable us to monitor and improve the performance of our website. For example, they allow us to count visits, identify traffic sources and see which parts of the site are most popular.
  • Functionality cookies: These cookies allow our website to remember the choices you make and provide enhanced features. For instance, we may be able to provide you with news or updates relevant to the services you use. They may also be used to provide services you have requested such as viewing a video or commenting on a blog. The information these cookies collect is usually anonymised.

seo.title: Marketing Consultancy Services
seo.description: Selected Clients Where marketing meets innovation, to bring strategy to life Discover Polything s comprehensive range

body.raw:
Selected Clients

Where marketing meets innovation,
to bring strategy to life

Discover Polything’s comprehensive range of strategic marketing consultancy services, designed to help your business grow and succeed. Our tailored range of services has been developed to ensure that your marketing efforts are effective, helping your brand out in competitive markets.

Services Overview

Marketing Strategy Services

Comprehensive strategies – Let us help you develop a holistic marketing plan encompassing all aspects of your brand’s growth. Our strategies are designed to elevate your brand and deliver measurable results through thorough market analysis and strategic implementation.

We go at your pace, either delivering intensive engagements over 2-3 months or spreading strategy development over an extended period to fit your needs.

Expert-led workshops – Benefit from our interactive workshops that provide deep insights into market trends, customer behaviour, and effective marketing tactics. These sessions equip you with the knowledge and skills to implement successful marketing strategies.

Actionable insights reports – Receive detailed reports with clear, actionable recommendations to improve your marketing efforts. These reports are based on comprehensive analysis and are tailored to your business context.

Learn More

Craft Creative & Marketing Services

Realise your brand vision with our marketing and creative production services, including design, video, animation, and more. Our team works closely with you to ensure each project reflects your brand’s unique identity and message.

Holistic approach – Integrate Craft seamlessly with your existing team to ensure consistency and impact across all channels, from initial concept to final execution.

Custom projects – Whether you require a single asset or a comprehensive marketing programme, our service is scalable to meet your needs and deliver high-quality results.

Subscription-based – Access a range of creative and marketing services through a fixed-price subscription model designed to scale with your business needs.

Learn More

Business Mentoring and Coaching

Engage in one-on-one sessions with an accredited business mentor to refine your business skills and strategy. These sessions focus on leveraging your strengths, overcoming challenges, and creating actionable plans to achieve your goals.

Custom growth plans – We will co-develop a bespoke growth plan tailored to your specific business objectives, helping you navigate the complexities of scaling and enhancing your market presence.

Support for Neurodivergent Founders – Specialised mentoring designed to address the unique challenges faced by neurodiverse business owners, fostering an inclusive and supportive growth environment.

Learn More

Polything offers a holistic approach to your marketing challenges, ensuring every aspect of your strategy is covered from planning to execution. Our founder, Chris, brings a wealth of experience and a personal touch to every project, ensuring your business receives the attention it deserves.

Download our services guide

Download

Free download, no email required.

What our customers say

“I would highly recommend them!!”

“They transformed the way we look at our online presence from the design of our site to our social media and content presence. Chris is an absolute pleasure to work with, extremely knowledgeable and has worked seamlessly with our team to make the necessary changes within our online offering.”

– Jon Case
CEO at SSS Learning Ltd

“Their wealth of experience was the deciding factor.”

“WOLF brought in more than 2 million new users from our target market in its first two years since brand launch. Polything assisted with a serious chunk of that due to the campaigns they worked on, and the creative and operational work they did to assist our MENA regionally-led influencer marketing campaigns that brought in the rest. I was very grateful to Polything.”

– Adam Gold
CCO at WOLF Live

“A huge impact on our business…”

“His work on our branded content proposition, productisation and social has transformed the way we look at monetising content. He has become a highly regarded part of the team and his knowledge, creativity, innovation and ingenuity have been invaluable in helping to develop our business.”

– Chris Dicker
CEO at Candr Media Group

What’s Next?

Step 1 – Reach Out

Begin your journey by scheduling a free consultation with our team.

During this session, we’ll discuss your business needs, current challenges, and objectives. This helps us understand how our services can best support your growth.

Step 2 – Implement

Based on the insights from our consultation, we conduct a thorough analysis of your current marketing efforts.

Our team then develops a custom marketing strategy with the Momentum Model based on your specific needs.

We then implemented (if you need us to), using our proven methodologies such as the Momentum Modle to ensure effective execution.

Step 3 – Grow

Watch your business thrive as we monitor and adjust your marketing strategy through our test-and-learn programme.

This iterative process ensures continuous improvement and optimal results, driving sustained growth and success for your business.

Enjoy continuous support and guidance from our experienced professionals to ensure your marketing efforts remain effective and aligned with your business goals.

GET IN TOUCH

Book a call

Case Studies

BLACKRIVER RAMPS

Black Friday / Cyber Monday Campaign – 22% increase in revenue compared to the previous year, and a 14.55 ROAS.

Explore

WOLF

The Worlds Online Festival – 2 million new users from our target market in its first two years since brand launch.

Explore

BLUEFORT

Explore how we refined Bluefort Security’s marketing with CRAFT and drove success.

Explore

Association Memberships

Latest news

  • Strategic Marketing Consultancy

    In today’s highly competitive business landscape, having a well-crafted marketing strategy is crucial for success. However, navigating the complexities of marketing can be challenging, especially for businesses with limited resources or specialised expertise. This is where strategic marketing consultants come into play, offering invaluable guidance and solutions tailored to your unique needs. In this comprehensive…

    Read more

    May 18, 2024

  • Marketing Consultancy in London – The secret to growing your business

    Choosing the right marketing consultancy in London is crucial for the success of your business and marketing campaigns. Find out more in this article.

    Read more

    May 6, 2023

  • Enhancing Your SEO for Better Online Visibility

    Enhancing your SEO strategies is essential for improving online visibility. This comprehensive guide covers the definition and importance of SEO visibility, key metrics and tools to measure it, and the major factors influencing it such as search engine rankings, mobile-friendliness, page speed, content quality, backlink strategy, and technical SEO factors.

    Read more

    September 23, 2024

  • Marketing Automation and Technology

    Discover how marketing automation and technology can revolutionise your marketing strategy. This article explores the benefits, essential tools, implementation tips, and future trends to streamline your efforts and drive growth. Learn from real-life success stories and gain actionable insights to boost your marketing efficiency. Read on to transform your approach!

    Read more

    August 26, 2024

  • Understanding customer journey maps – A guide to the process

    Read on to understand how focusing on the customer journey can make your business more customer-centric and elevate your marketing.

    Read more

    July 29, 2024

seo.title: Sustainability Statement
seo.description: At Polything, we believe that responsible marketing is not just about promoting products and services—it s about

body.raw:
At Polything, we believe that responsible marketing is not just about promoting products and services—it’s about fostering a sustainable future for our planet. As a marketing consultancy, we are acutely aware of the environmental impacts associated with our industry. That’s why we are committed to mitigating these effects and raising awareness among our clients about what sustainable growth truly means in marketing.

Our Commitment to Environmental Sustainability

  • Current Footprint: Our estimated annual carbon footprint is 1.67 tonnes of CO₂e per employee, totalling 3.33 tonnes for our entire company. This is 60% lower than the industry average, but we recognise there’s more work to be done. For information on how this has been calculated please visit Small99.
  • Actions Taken:
    • Switched to Renewable Energy: We have moved to Ecotricity as our energy supplier, ensuring that our operations are powered by 100% renewable sources.
    • Implemented Energy-Efficient Lighting: We’ve conducted an audit of our lighting systems and replaced all non-LED lights with energy-efficient LEDs to reduce energy consumption.
    • Home Energy Initiatives: For our team members working from home, we’ve encouraged and facilitated the switch to renewable energy suppliers.
  • Ongoing Efforts:
    • Measuring Our Carbon Footprint: We’re utilising tools like Sage Earth and Clean Growth UK to accurately measure and monitor our emissions.
    • Supply Chain Evaluation: We’re exporting supply chain data to understand the environmental impact of our top suppliers.

Future Goals

  • Carbon Negative by 2030: We aim to not just offset but exceed our carbon emissions, making us carbon negative.
  • Continuous Improvement: We’re exploring innovative solutions for carbon reduction and investing in technologies that support our sustainability objectives.

Social Responsibility

  • Client Advocacy: We’re proactively engaging with our clients to discuss their sustainability agendas, encouraging them to measure their carbon footprints and adopt renewable energy solutions.
  • Team Engagement: Our team is our greatest asset. We hold monthly meetings to share progress, brainstorm ideas, and ensure everyone contributes to our sustainability journey.
  • Community Involvement: We’re exploring opportunities for volunteering and charitable donations to support environmental causes within our community.

Supply Chain Management

  • Sustainable Partnerships: We prioritise working with suppliers who share our commitment to sustainability. For instance, we use Google Workspace, which is striving for net-zero emissions and 24/7 carbon-free energy operations by 2030.
  • Supplier Support: We engage with our suppliers to understand their sustainability practices and offer support to align their efforts with our goals.

Stakeholder Engagement

  • Open Communication: We maintain transparent communication with our employees, clients, and other stakeholders about our sustainability initiatives.
  • Collaborative Efforts: Feedback and collaboration are encouraged to enhance our ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) strategies.

Join Us on Our Journey

Sustainability is a collective effort. We invite our clients, partners, and community to join us in redefining sustainable growth in marketing. Together, we can make a meaningful impact on the environment while driving success for our businesses.

Contact Us

For more information about our sustainability initiatives or to collaborate with us on environmentally responsible marketing strategies, please get in touch.
