seo.title: Terms and Conditions
seo.description: Terms and Conditions Welcome to Polything. These terms and conditions outline the rules and regulations for

body.raw:
Terms and Conditions

Welcome to Polything.

These terms and conditions outline the rules and regulations for the use of Polything Ltd’s Website, located at https://polything.co.uk.

By accessing this website we assume you accept these terms and conditions. Do not continue to use Polything if you do not agree to take all of the terms and conditions stated on this page.

The following terminology applies to these Terms and Conditions, Privacy Statement and Disclaimer Notice and all Agreements: “Client”, “You” and “Your” refers to you, the person log on this website and is compliant with the Company’s terms and conditions. “The Company”, “Ourselves”, “We”, “Our” and “Us”, refers to our Company. “Party”, “Parties”, or “Us”, refers to both the Client and ourselves. All terms refer to the offer, acceptance and consideration of payment necessary to undertake the process of our assistance to the Client in the most appropriate manner for the express purpose of meeting the Client’s needs in respect of the provision of the Company’s stated services, in accordance with and subject to, prevailing law of Netherlands. Any use of the above terminology or other words in the singular, plural, capitalization and/or he/she or they, are taken as interchangeable and therefore as referring to the same.

Cookies

We employ the use of cookies. By accessing Polything, you agreed to use cookies in agreement with Polything Ltd’s Privacy Policy.

Most interactive websites use cookies to let us retrieve the user’s details for each visit. Cookies are used by our website to enable the functionality of certain areas to make it easier for people visiting our website. Some of our affiliate/advertising partners may also use cookies.

License

Unless otherwise stated, Polything Ltd and/or its licensors own the intellectual property rights for all material on Website Name. All intellectual property rights are reserved. You may access this from Polything for your own personal use subjected to restrictions set in these terms and conditions.

You must not:

  • Republish material from Website Name
  • Sell, rent or sub-license material from Website Name
  • Reproduce, duplicate or copy material from Website Name
  • Redistribute content from Website Name

This Agreement shall begin on the date hereof.

Parts of this website offer an opportunity for users to post and exchange opinions and information in certain areas of the website. Polything Ltd does not filter, edit, publish or review Comments prior to their presence on the website. Comments do not reflect the views and opinions of Polything Ltd, its agents and/or affiliates. Comments reflect the views and opinions of the person who posts their views and opinions. To the extent permitted by applicable laws, Polything Ltd shall not be liable for the Comments or for any liability, damages or expenses caused and/or suffered as a result of any use of and/or posting of and/or appearance of the Comments on this website.

Polything Ltd reserves the right to monitor all Comments and to remove any Comments which can be considered inappropriate, offensive or causes a breach of these Terms and Conditions.

You warrant and represent that:

  • You are entitled to post the Comments on our website and have all necessary licenses and consents to do so;
  • The Comments do not invade any intellectual property right, including without limitation copyright, patent or trademark of any third party;
  • The Comments do not contain any defamatory, libellous, offensive, indecent or otherwise unlawful material which is an invasion of privacy
  • The Comments will not be used to solicit or promote business or custom or present commercial activities or unlawful activity.

You hereby grant Polything Ltd a non-exclusive license to use, reproduce, edit and authorize others to use, reproduce and edit any of your Comments in any and all forms, formats or media.

Hyperlinking to our Content

The following organizations may link to our Website without prior written approval:

  • Government agencies;
  • Search engines;
  • News organizations;
  • Online directory distributors may link to our Website in the same manner as they hyperlink to the Websites of other listed businesses; and
  • System-wide Accredited Businesses except soliciting non-profit organizations, charity shopping malls, and charity fundraising groups which may not hyperlink to our Web site.

These organizations may link to our home page, to publications or to other Website information so long as the link: (a) is not in any way deceptive; (b) does not falsely imply sponsorship, endorsement or approval of the linking party and its products and/or services; and (c) fits within the context of the linking party’s site.

We may consider and approve other link requests from the following types of organizations:

  • commonly-known consumer and/or business information sources;
  • dot.com community sites;
  • associations or other groups representing charities;
  • online directory distributors;
  • internet portals;
  • accounting, law and consulting firms; and
  • educational institutions and trade associations.

We will approve link requests from these organizations if we decide that: (a) the link would not make us look unfavourably to ourselves or to our accredited businesses; (b) the organization does not have any negative records with us; (c) the benefit to us from the visibility of the hyperlink compensates the absence of Polything Ltd, and (d) the link is in the context of general resource information.

These organizations may link to our home page so long as the link: (a) is not in any way deceptive; (b) does not falsely imply sponsorship, endorsement or approval of the linking party and its products or services; and (c) fits within the context of the linking party’s site.

If you are one of the organizations listed in paragraph 2 above and are interested in linking to our website, you must inform us by sending an e-mail to Polything Ltd. Please include your name, your organization name, contact information as well as the URL of your site, a list of any URLs from which you intend to link to our Website, and a list of the URLs on our site to which you would like to link. Wait 4 weeks for a response.

Approved organizations may hyperlink to our Website as follows:

  • By use of our corporate name; or
  • By use of the uniform resource locator being linked to; or
  • By use of any other description of our Website being linked to that makes sense within the context and format of content on the linking party’s site.

No use of Polything’s logo or other artwork will be allowed for linking absent a trademark license agreement.

iFrames

Without prior approval and written permission, you may not create frames around our Webpages that alter in any way the visual presentation or appearance of our Website.

Content Liability

We shall not be held responsible for any content that appears on your Website. You agree to protect and defend us against all claims that are rising on your Website. No link(s) should appear on any Website that may be interpreted as libellous, obscene or criminal, or which infringes, otherwise violates, or advocates the infringement or other violation of, any third party rights.

Reservation of Rights

We reserve the right to request that you remove all links or any particular link to our Website. You approve to immediately remove all links to our Website upon request. seo.title: Thank you!
seo.description: Thanks for signing up! Why not see if there is a fit? Book a 15

body.raw:
Thanks for signing up!

Why not see if there is a fit? Book a 15 min call.
Booking Link

Latest Posts

  • Strategic Marketing Consultancy

    In today’s highly competitive business landscape, having a well-crafted marketing strategy is crucial for success. However, navigating the complexities of marketing can be challenging, especially for businesses with limited resources or specialised expertise. This is where strategic marketing consultants come into play, offering invaluable guidance and solutions tailored to your unique needs. In this comprehensive…

    Read more

    May 18, 2024

  • Marketing Consultancy in London – The secret to growing your business

    Choosing the right marketing consultancy in London is crucial for the success of your business and marketing campaigns. Find out more in this article.

    Read more

    May 6, 2023

  • Enhancing Your SEO for Better Online Visibility

    Enhancing your SEO strategies is essential for improving online visibility. This comprehensive guide covers the definition and importance of SEO visibility, key metrics and tools to measure it, and the major factors influencing it such as search engine rankings, mobile-friendliness, page speed, content quality, backlink strategy, and technical SEO factors.

    Read more

    September 23, 2024

  • Marketing Automation and Technology

    Discover how marketing automation and technology can revolutionise your marketing strategy. This article explores the benefits, essential tools, implementation tips, and future trends to streamline your efforts and drive growth. Learn from real-life success stories and gain actionable insights to boost your marketing efficiency. Read on to transform your approach!

    Read more

    August 26, 2024

  • Understanding customer journey maps – A guide to the process

    Read on to understand how focusing on the customer journey can make your business more customer-centric and elevate your marketing.

    Read more

    July 29, 2024

seo.title: Value by Design™ (Lite Edition)
seo.description: You’ve just invested in clarity — and we’re thrilled to have you here. Welcome to

body.raw:
You’ve just invested in clarity — and we’re thrilled to have you here.

Welcome to the Value by Design™ programme, a step-by-step journey that turns the swirl of ideas in your head into a value story your customers, investors, and team can rally behind. You’ve said “yes” to sharper messaging, faster decisions, and a brand that feels unmistakably you — smart move.

What happens next

  1. Discover – a quick voice interview (Stage 1) captures the heart of your customers’ pains and gains.
  2. Define – a follow-up product chat maps every feature to those real-world needs.
  3. Distil – our AI analysts cross-check both canvases and surface the gold.
  4. Decide – in the Fit Workshop you’ll lock the strongest pain-reliever / gain-creator pairs and craft a punch-perfect value proposition.

Why you’re in good hands

  • Warm, collaborative approach – we guide, you steer. No jargon, no pressure.
  • Story-driven strategy – every insight ladders up to a narrative that moves people.
  • Practical outcomes – PDFs, talking points, and priority maps you can action the same day.

How to get the most from today

  • Set aside 10 quiet minutes before you hit “Start” on Stage 1. Jot a one-line description of what you do and the top three headaches you solve.
  • Speak naturally during the interview – real words beat polished slogans every time.
  • Trust the process – each step flows into the next, and we’ll nudge you when it’s time to move on.

Ready to begin? Scroll down and press “Start Your Interview”. We’ll do the heavy lifting; you focus on telling the story only you can tell.

We’re excited to hear it.

Start Now

seo.title: Stage 1- Value by Design™ (Lite Ed)
seo.description: Welcome to Your Customer Value Canvas Journey, and thanks again for your purchase! We’ve built

body.raw:
Welcome to Your Customer Value Canvas Journey, and thanks again for your purchase!

We’ve built this space so you can capture the story, strengths, and stretch-goals of your business in one conversation. Over the next few minutes you’ll speak with our CVC Interviewer (powered by ElevenLabs) while our on-page chatbot keeps everything organised behind the scenes. By the end, you’ll have the raw insight we need to craft a laser-focused Value Proposition that feels uniquely you.

Meet Your CVC Interviewer

Think of the interviewer as a calm, curious strategist with a microphone:

  • It asks concise, open questions—then listens.
  • It reflects your answers back to you, so you can tweak them live.
  • It tags each section (Overview, Audience, Pain Points, Gains, etc.) so nothing slips through the cracks.

How to Prepare (takes five minutes)

Grab a notepad—or open a blank doc—and jot down:

  1. One-line description of what you do.
  2. Industry/vertical you play in (e.g., SaaS, DTC fashion).
  3. Top three customer headaches you solve.
  4. A quick sketch of your dream client (size, role, budget).
  5. Any metrics or milestones you’re proud of (revenue, NPS, growth rate).

If you don’t have every detail, no stress; the interviewer will guide you.

Step-by-Step Instructions

Friendly Tips

  • Be honest, not perfect. Real wording beats polished slogans.
  • Story beats stats—examples help us see the colour in your brand.
  • If a question feels off-target, tell us; the interviewer can pivot.
  • Background noise? Hit the mute icon between answers.
  • Need a moment? Just say “pause”, then “resume” when ready.

Ready to dive in?

Click Start Interview below and let’s begin shaping a value proposition that sparks growth and feels 100 per cent authentic to you. We’re excited to listen

seo.title: Stage 2- Value by Design™ (Lite Ed)
seo.description: Welcome to Your Product Value Canvas (PVC) Session You’ve already mapped your customer’s world in

body.raw:
Welcome to Your Product Value Canvas (PVC) Session

You’ve already mapped your customer’s world in the CVC interview; now we’ll zero-in on what your product or service must deliver to create real, “can’t-live-without-it” value. In the next conversation, you’ll speak with our PVC Interviewer (also voice-enabled via ElevenLabs) while the on-page chatbot organises every insight in the background. When we’re done, you’ll have a crystal-clear list of Features, Pain-Relievers, and Gain-Creators ready for the Fit Workshop.

Meet Your PVC Interviewer

Picture a product strategist with the bedside manner of a coach:

  • Starts by anchoring to the pains and gains you surfaced in the CVC.
  • Digs for the functional facts — features, workflows, proof-points.
  • Probes the “so-what?” layer: How does this remove a pain? How could it delight?
  • Summarises each block (Features ▸ Pain-Relievers ▸ Gain-Creators) so you can confirm or refine on the spot.

Quick Prep – 5 Minutes Tops

Have these notes (or rough thoughts) within reach:

  1. Top 5 product features your buyers rave about.
  2. Proof of impact: metrics, case-study wins, testimonials.
  3. Secret sauce / differentiators you’re proud of.
  4. Known constraints (lead-times, integrations, pricing quirks).
  5. Any future features you’re considering.

Don’t sweat perfect wording; raw bullets are fine — the interviewer turns them into structured canvas blocks.

Step-by-Step Instructions

Friendly Tips

  • Think benefits, not just specs — e.g., “one-click sync that saves 3 hours” is gold.
  • Stories beat bullet points: share a customer quote if you have one.
  • If a prompt feels off-target, just say so; the interviewer will pivot.
  • Say “pause” anytime you need a breather, then “resume”.
  • Keep background noise low (mute icon is top-right).

Ready?

Hit Start Interview below and let’s translate your product’s superpowers into a value map your customers can’t ignore — all in the same warm, genuine tone you know from our first session.

seo.title: Stage 3 – Value by Design™ (Lite Ed)
seo.description: Welcome to Your CVC + PVC Insight Engine This page is the quiet control room

body.raw:
Welcome to Your CVC + PVC Insight Engine

This page is the quiet control room where your two interview transcripts meet a pair of specialist AI analysts. While they cross-match customer pains with product gains and surface any gaps, you can simply keep the tab open—then collect a crisp, merged brief the moment the run completes.

(One-stop page for the two “deep-dive” analysis runs)

What happens on this page — in plain English

  1. We ingest your interview transcripts
    The raw audio + confirmed summaries from the CVC and PVC calls are pushed into a secure analysis thread that only you and our system can see. Our two researchers have been working quietly in the background, their comprehensive research will be surfaced to you with the help of our analysts.
  2. Two specialised analysts get to work
    • CVC Analyst distils customer jobs, pains, gains, and buying triggers.
    • PVC Analyst maps each product feature to the pains/gains it resolves and flags any gaps.
  3. Cross-check & merge
    A supervisor agent compares both outputs, highlights mismatches (“feature with no pain” or “pain with no feature”), and bundles everything into one tidy brief.
  4. Delivery
    As soon as the run shows Status: complete, you’ll receive an email titled “Your Fit Workshop is ready” with:
    • a copy of the deep research of each researcher
    • a PDF snapshot of both canvases
    • a link to the next (Fit Workshop) page, already pre-filled with your data.

What you need to do right now

Start CVC
Start PVC

Behind-the-scenes (for the curious)

  • Tech stack: OpenAI Assistants (or Responses API) + Agents SDK orchestrator
  • Security: PII-stripped transcripts; zero-retention mode on external calls; 256-bit-encrypted storage
  • Rate-limits & retries: The page auto-retries failed calls up to 3× with exponential back-off—no manual refresh required.

Troubleshooting

Final stop → Fit Workshop

Once you’ve got the confirmation email, head to the Fit Workshop page to prioritise which features, pains, and gains make the strongest market story. We’ll be waiting there with your freshly-minted canvases in hand.

Thanks for your patience—your insights are cooking!

seo.title: Stage 4 – Value by Design™ (Lite Ed)
seo.description: Welcome to Your Fit Workshop The heavy lifting is done—this is where our analysts help

body.raw:
Welcome to Your Fit Workshop

The heavy lifting is done—this is where our analysts help you make sense and match every customer pain to a product gain. This Workshop is where you shape the story into a market-ready promise. In about 15 minutes you’ll pick the highest-impact Jobs, Pain-Reliever/Gain-Creator pairs, land on a concise Value Proposition, and export a roadmap you can share with investors, marketers, copywriters, designers, and ad managers alike.

What You’ll Walk Away With

For each segment we have worked on together you get:

  • One-sentence Value Proposition that balances aspiration with proof.
  • Priority matrix (Must-Have → Nice-to-Have) for features and benefits.
  • Messaging starter pack— three adlibs for the highest priority job, pains and gains you should test. These are now backed by data, research and refined by you. We will also show you how to test and use them for a multitude of different purposes

Quick Prep

  1. Download the Insight Brief (pdf link above) so you can reference the full canvases.
  2. Have any team feedback or objections handy; we’ll let you log them as notes.
  3. Block a distraction-free quarter-hour—momentum matters.

Step-by-Step

Estimated runtime: 10–15 min.

Pro Tips

  • Real examples trump theory—swap in a customer quote or stat during Step 4 to boost credibility.
  • If a feature has no clear pain attached, park it in the Future quadrant; don’t let it muddy the core story.
  • Use the “Objection” sticky notes to capture internal push-back now instead of at launch.

After You Click “Finish”

  1. We save the final canvas + VP to your private dashboard.
  2. An email with the PDF and messaging pack lands in your inbox.
  3. You’ll see links to:
    • Launch Checklist (turn the VP into copy, ads, onboarding emails)
    • Workshop Bundle all your canvases, adlibs and research in one place
    • Application Bundle Ideas on how to use your value propositions in the real world
    • Feedback Loop form—tell us how the session felt and what you’ll test next.

Ready to craft a Value Proposition that sticks? Scroll down, confirm your pains & gains, and let’s lock in the story your customers have been waiting to hear.

Start Now
